name: Bangkok Expat Social Drinks Club
description:
The Bangkok Expat Social Drinks Club is a Meetup group that we were searching for but couldn't find. No gimmicks, no exclusions just a bunch of legends that share a common love for a few after work wets & some reasonable chat between friends. I imagine that some of these events may end up going late in to the night but only if the Procecco is fresh and the beers are cold.

It can be quite daunting socializing & putting a circle of friends together when moving to a new city. A little less daunting after 6 or 7 Changs or whiskey sours are involved though. If you're a person that can relate to that sentiment than this is the Meetup for you.

Think after work drinks on a Friday afternoon as soon as it's culturally appropriate. Think of cocktails on a Sunday afternoon. Think of downing a regrettable tequila shooter at the bar at 11pm on Saturday before someone bully's you into going to that club you said you'd never go too.

This is what the Bangkok Expat Social Drinks Club is all about. It's a conduit to social & professional networking. It's drinking until you have a team to call you own in this amazing city.

name: Little Bangkok Sangha : Meditation group
description:
Hi - welcome to our Little Bangkok Sangha.

When I came to Bangkok in 2001 there was no dharma in English to be found. The temples are all happy to compete for the tourist dollar, but there was no explanations, no sangha, no friends on the path.

So I started the ball rolling. That was 2007. Now we organize lots of events, and bring people together from all kinds of meditation backgrounds.

There are regular dhamma talks, workshops, discussion events, lunches and sometimes retreats. It depends on visiting teachers schedules.

Since we have no permanent venue of our own (yet) we have few costs. Pretty much everything we do is without cost - except for retreats of course - but even those are as low cost as we can make it.

I hope you can join in. If you are new it takes a while for your face and name to be remembered, but you should find an interesting mix of people. (plus a few real oddballs!)

The full website is at www.littlebang.org  - the calendars there feature all events, arranged by us and other groups. Here on Meetup we only feature our own events - that's already a ton of emails that Meetup sends out!!

Hope to meet you.

Pandit Bhikkhu

name: Startups in Bangkok
description:
Why should you join the Startups in Bangkok Networking Meetup? 

Do you want to meet like-minded entrepreneurs? Grow your business faster? Find co-founders or partners? 

This meetup facilitates casual networking events that will allow you to make the valuable contacts necessary to grow your startup.

Our Monthly Networking Meetups are organized in dozens of cities around the world, either by volunteers or exclusive Community Leaders in each city. 

Other than our monthly Networking events, we also feature events offered by the community (that’s you!).

Another great way for you to network and expand your business connections is to join a coworking space! Members of the group are eligible for up to 15% discount from our partners at WeWork, the world’s leading coworking network! https://wework.startupblink.com/ 

What is StartupBlink? 

StartupBlink is an interactive global startup ecosystem map and research center featuring tens of thousands of listed startups, coworking spaces, and accelerators. Add yours as well to Bangkok Startup Map - https://www.startupblink.com/startups/bangkok+thailand

Who organizes the events?

The events are organized by the members of the group. If you like, you can choose the location and take charge of our next monthly networking event (just send us a message). You may also become our exclusive Bangkok Community Leader. https://communityleaders.startupblink.com/

Looking for a coworking space in Bangkok? Check out all the options along with prices, photos, member reviews and more on Coworker.com https://www.coworker.com/search/bangkok/thailand

All meetups are hosted in accordance with the terms of use posted on https://www.startupblink.com/blog/terms-conditions/

name: Elastic Thailand User Group
description:
This group is for anyone interested in Elastic open source projects Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats, (www.elastic.co/products). We cover search, logging, analytics & data visualization. We welcome talks on any aspect of data exploration.

Getting involved with the community

Presenting a talk 🎙️ it could take from 5 min up to 45 minutes with Q&A, either way, we want to hear from you 🗣! Take a look at our Speaker Guide [1] for great tips on giving a stellar 👏presentation. If you’re interested visit the elastic/call-for-meetups repo [2].

[1]: https://eemrich.gitbooks.io/elastic-user-group-speaker-guidelines/content/
[2]: https://github.com/elastic/call-for-meetups

––––––––––––

🏢 Host a meetup:
Hosting a meetup at your office, is another way to get more involved with the community. This is a great way to showcase your space (especially if you’re trying to recruit). Your facilities don't need to be fancy — we're looking for a comfortable vibe, a projector, screen, chairs, and a place to serve refreshments. Email meetups@elastic.co if you’re interested.

––––––––––––

🎉 Local community organizers wanted!
We’d love to have this user group meet more regularly, so we’re looking for a local organizer who will help the group thrive, and the Community Team at Elastic is here to support you. If you’re interested email us at meetups@elastic.co.
We know that people enjoy giving back to the communities they care about, so we've created a guide [1] to help you get started on your path to starting a Meetup.com user group.
[1]: https://www.elastic.co/community/usergroupguide#overview

🏆What you’ll gain by being a Community Organizer?:
• Public speaking experience
• Community leadership and contribution
• Networking opportunities
• Learn new technical use cases and share your expertise
• Special Elastic swag (and bragging rights, of course).

🌟Expectations:
• Be a fan of Elastic and possess motivation to help build the community
• Commit to organizing the user group for at least one calendar year (at least 3-4 meetups a year)
• Attend the meetups
• Help find speakers and hosts (Elastic can help connect you with other users)
• Create meetup.com announcement (Elastic can help promote)
• Order food & beverages (Elastic is happy to sponsor)

–––––––––––– 

🎓 Learn more about Elastic
• Elastic Community: https://www.elastic.co/community

name: Bangkok New in Town Meetup
description:
Bangkok is an amazing city! It is booming and vibrant and just so much fun. It attracts people from all parts of the world for short and long term stays. The city can however be a challenge is you do not speak Thai and because the culture is warm but new. It can be even more isolating if you are a bit older, are new in the city and do not have any friends or social network in the city.

I want to bring together like minded members of all ages at relatively quiet locations including bars and restaurants where people can meet each other and establish connections and friendships beyond mere acquaintances.

We will organise our meetups so that we are small enough in number to remember most names and exchange numbers with many by the end of it. We will strive to offer a comforting and warm group which comprises of internationally minded members with a high degree of sensitivity and warmth.

We will meet mainly on weekends when most of us are free and keen to meet others at bars and pubs in the CBD area. This group will be all about friendships and connections and having fun.

name: Bangkok Expat Women
description:
This group initially started as a club for trailing spouses who have relocated to Thailand with their significant others but has evolved into a group for expat ladies of all walks of life who have moved to Bangkok for the long-term (this means 6 months or more)! Single or married, working or not, it doesn't matter! Please join us and add to our diversity for an even richer experience.

If there is anything you think this group would like to partake in, feel free to suggest a meetup. With that being said, please get to know us and socialize with us before you try to suggest a meetup for your business. If your sole purpose of joining our group is to promote, then we suggest you find a different group. =)

Feel free to post on the discussion forum any questions you have about living in Bangkok and hopefully someone in our network will have an answer for you!

Lastly, we want this to be an active participating group, so if 6 months goes by and you have not signed into this site, you'll receive a gentle reminder email from an Organizer that you are about to be removed from the site. Within 7 days, if you have not yet visited the Meetup site, you will be removed from our group. TWO no-shows members will be removed from the group. Of course, you can always re-request membership when you are ready to be active again.

Thanks so much for asking to be a member of our community and hope to see you at one of our upcoming events!

Note: 

**Please do not request if you are not a woman, not an expat or if you are only in Bangkok temporarily.  Membership is up to the discretion of all our organizers.   

**One profile picture (Your face), name must not be your nickname, and full answers to initial questionnaire are required for membership.

** We collect 50thb per person per event

name: Mundo Lingo Bangkok
description:
Mundo Lingo is a sociable and free new way for locals and internationals to meet and practice languages or just make friends as much with locals as tourists.

Bangkok currently has one weekly event: 
*******NEW VENUE UNDER INVESTIGATION. TEMPORARILY POSTPONED THE EVENT. UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.


All nationalities and ages | 
Our aim is to bring the international communities in closer to the local community. Meet people from all kinds of amazing backgrounds speaking all sorts of different languages from all over the world. There are no limits and nobody is exempt. We get together for good conversation, to make friends and have a nice time.

How does it work? | 
Guests are given flag-stickers to stick on their chest. These flags represent the languages the guest speaks and go in order of fluency from strongest at the top to weakest at the bottom - Easy! 

We have one suggestion | 
"Stay standing and only sit down for a private conversation". 
Why? Because if you stand it's easier for people to catch your eye and come and talk to you, and visa versa. It allows people to move and flow from group to group in a way you just can't achieve sitting down.

How many people go? | 
In Bangkok we expect around 200 people per event. 
Most participants are not members of MeetUp so don't be put off if numbers are low here, we're a well established event.

People look young and pretty in the photos, am I too old?| 
Nah! We just have really good photographers. This event is for all ages. The majority are 25 to 45 but we get plenty of people from outside those parameters too. 

Around Thailand and the world | 
ML is in Bangkok and Chiang Mai. We're also in 26 cities around the world including Barcelona, Buenos Aires, London, New York, Montreal, Paris, Saigon and Melbourne + many more. Check our website for full information on all of our host cities and events: mundolingo.org

You can visit our website which has information on all of our cities and events: mundolingo.org

The bottom line| 
It’s for all levels and nationalities and its completely free. Whoever you are, you're welcome to join us.

name: Key-Bangers Bangkok
description:
This is a group for writers. Non-fiction or fiction. Published or not. We bring our stories to the group for honest feedback. All stories must belong to the group members.

***

In order to increase the quantity and quality of feedback we receive on our writing we are revamping the format of our meet-ups. This is a work in progress; nothing will be carved in stone. We’ll try it, see how it works, and then either tweak it or start all over again. (Kind of like writing, isn’t it?)

So, here’s a big picture description of what we’re doing:

There will no longer be time allotted during the meet-ups for reading the pieces. Any work that you would like to have critiqued will need to be posted to the website by Wednesday before the Sunday meet-up so that we will have time to read it. You should keep bringing paper copies so we can write comments on them. Start time will be at 11:00 and discussion will start promptly at 11:20.

For discussion we will go around the table allowing each person an allotted amount of interruption-free talk time to address the piece and when their time is up, it’s up, and the floor will be given to the next person. Then when everyone has been given a chance to talk about a piece we’ll go on to the next one. The host will be in charge of managing time. Time allotted to each story will depend on the number of stories we have on that day.

Story limit remains 5,000 words but if you have a longer piece and you post your story before the deadline, chances are we’ll read it. We’ll discuss the stories in the order they’re posted on the website. Please keep the comments related to writing, not the subject matter.

! NEW MEMBERS !

You will have to come to at least 3 meet-ups over a period of 3 months before you’ll be given access to the group’s private website.
After you RSVP for the first time, I will send you a private message. Please respond no later than the Friday before the meet-up. If you don’t, I will remove you from the list. (We’ve had far too many people who RSVP, don’t show up, and are never heard of again. It creates problems with booking the seats, and time allocation for each story.) That also means you will have to RSVP by Friday (the meet-up is on Sunday).

name: Bangkok Philosophy and Great Classics Discussion Group
description:
The raison d'etre of this group can be found in the word of Adam Smith.    He writes,

"When we have read a book or poem so often that we can no longer find any amusement in reading it by ourselves, we can still take pleasure in reading it to a companion. To him it has all the graces of novelty; we enter into the surprise and admiration which it naturally excites in him, but which it is no longer capable of exciting in us; we consider all the ideas which it presents rather in the light in which they appear to him, than in that in which they appear to ourselves, and we are amused by sympathy with his amusement which thus enlivens our own.”


The purpose of this group is to elucidate complex short works of philosophy.  The goal is not to observe or give generalized impressions from having read a particular work decades ago or rehash the meaning of a particular phrase that is known universally but to have a book in front of you to cite directly or indirectly after having done the reading.  When I conceptualized the group I assumed it would involve individuals talking about certain passages of interest from the first ten pages, the next ten pages, and so on, with conversation being built around it.  I also assumed that it would consist of  several fairly committed and responsible people who would come each time and become friends in the shared admiration of great and thoughtful masters, NOT in derailing the purpose by veering the conversation off the tracks in full refutation and dismissal  of what we are studying, or being fed a few morsels from which you are able to give clever repartees.    I saw it as a means to be of assistance to others in this goal to approach truth and understanding of the text.  

As Mortimer Adler states it in How to Read a Book the only person who knows a book fully is the author, and so the reader is trying to come as close to reaching the author's understanding as he can do.  If you click the button saying that you will come you need to do it weeks before the meeting and that click needs to mean something.  It needs to be a solemn pledge that you will read the material to the best of your ability and help the group members in understanding the work.  It should not be some lackadaisical idea that if you have time and remember to come you will have a beer and run your mouth.  Yes, we have had occurences where the group was hostage to people making long speeches decrying a work and arguing in favor of an entirely different author.  These are serious writers, and our group has a serious agenda, so why treat it with such flippant disdain?   If your membership was deleted you are welcome to rejoin the group but there are questions that you must answer first. Call it a litmus test or vetting process in a sense, as I want to find out if you have the ability to appreciate the sacrifices these very great men made of their lives to give to you their higher thoughts. A candidate for these meetings must be humbled by this great gift and I want to know that he or she will actually read the material and come into the meeting with it in his or her hands. It isnt a lot to ask for, is it? And if you state that you will come with an RSVP, contribute somehow by at least contributing to the discussion board if you cannot be present.

We also have Facebook group to support with more resources. 
Join now! 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/WeMeditateGroup 


Who does it? 
Founded by Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi in 1970 and practiced in over 100 countries. No prior meditation experience is required. 

What is it? 

Sahaja Yoga Meditation is a simple, time-honored technique that lets you tap into that energy and harness its power to become better balanced and better connected to yourself — emotionally, physically, mentally, and spiritually. Anyone can do it. Sahaja Yoga meditation is natural and easy. A structured guided meditation is always included. In this way, you will both experience meditation, and be able to start meditating at home from the first day you start. Beneficial and instructive for both beginners and the experienced. 

Why do it? 

If you're having trouble juggling the challenges in your life, Sahaja Yoga Meditation might well help you manage stress, master your emotions and find solutions to your problems. You may enjoy better health, better focus, and a deeper understanding of the universe and your place in it.Meditation is not just for mystics and monks. Ready to plug into your inner energy? A few minutes of your life may be all it takes to connect to your inner energy and light the path to lifelong transformation. Sahaja Yoga is more than a temporary solution or quick relief — it is a journey, rather than a destination. All sessions are free. No strings, no catch.Everyone is welcome. 

How is it done? 

– Socialize a bit and know other participants with similar aspirations 

– Introduction – suitable for complete beginners. How to meditate, and balance your inner being– About chakras and techniques to cleanse them 

– Guided meditation & experience awakening of energy. Silent meditation– Silent meditation and on music based of notes suitable for specific energy centers– Going deeper on specific topic, followed by one to one session with guidance on how to continue practice at home and any address any queries you may have. 

In case you miss any of our session, you are always welcome to join our Facebook group for more resources and guided meditation sessions

description:
Anybody interested in GraphQL or related technologies like Apollo, AppSync, Primsa, Gatsby and so - join us in our hopefully bi-monthly events.

About GraphQL

GraphQL was developed internally at Facebook in 2012. Its main goal was to allow Native Mobile teams to quickly build new products and collaborate within the large Facebook ecosystem without disrupting existing Data Services. In July 2015, Facebook decided to open source it. They published an specification (https://facebook.github.io/graphql/), and provided a reference implementation, using JavaScript (graphql-js (https://github.com/graphql/graphql-js)), to get feedback from the community and allow other implementations to emerge.

GraphQL can be used either to refer to the GraphQL Specification (https://facebook.github.io/graphql/), an implementation of a GraphQL Server or the Data Query Language.

Today there are many GraphQL Server implementations using: Python (graphene (https://github.com/graphql-python/graphene)), Scala (sangria (https://github.com/sangria-graphql/sangria)), Go (https://github.com/graphql-go/graphql), PHP (https://github.com/webonyx/graphql-php), Java (https://github.com/graphql-java/graphql-java) and more (https://github.com/chentsulin/awesome-graphql)!

• Seek perfection constantly
• Need to be right

Who are the Capitol Toastmasters?

Members come from across the world. With members from more than 30 countries, club meetings are always culturally diverse. Visit one of our meetings and you'll sense an environment mixing a strong professional atmosphere with a little bit of fun, a lot of humor, and an array of individual cultural perspectives that help make our meetings the highlight of the week.

How do I visit as a guest?

Guests are always welcome to attend any of our regular meetings. We meet on the following days and times:

Every Tuesday at 6:30 - 8:30 PM

Cost: 200 Baht per person, paid at the door.

Location: Sheraton Grande Sukhumvit Hotel It is located next to the BTS Asoke and MRT Sukhumvit stations. Come and sing! Let's raise our vibration (•ᴗ•) Singing together is a profoundly human activity. All ages, cultures and backgrounds welcome! Families and small kids welcome!

Kirtan (pronounced keer-tahn) is a musical conversation, where we sing ancient mantras set to music. Typically it is done with a leader who "calls" the mantra, and the group who "echoes" the mantra, so we are singing back and forth to one another.

We set the mantras to music (as opposed to just speaking the words) because music bypasses the conscious, rational processes of the brain and helps access our emotions directly. Kirtan helps you tap into feelings of love, devotion, peace, and unity that are already present within your heart.

Kirtan is equal parts science and art. Humans figured out long ago that singing this way nourishes the mind, body and soul. By chanting together, we entrain our individual vibrations and raise each other up in a positive, loving way. Kirtan feels awesome! You don't have to have any musical talent or experience with yoga to enjoy kirtan - it is for everyone.


Part of the beauty of kirtan is that it operates on many levels simultaneously.
Kirtan can:
♢ increase lung capacity to create deeper breathing

♦ restore balance between the right and left hemispheres of the brain, and between the physical and subtle bodies

♢ cultivate a meditative practice of being in the moment with the music -- turn off the anxious monkeymind ;)

♦ activate the parasympathetic nervous system, creating the relaxed state necessary for the body to heal itself

♢ provide an authentic way to spend time with people from many cultures and walks of life

♦ empower your energy system with the healing frequencies contained in ancient mantras

♢ help you connect with the divine aspects of yourself

The kirtan experience can be different from day to day and from one song to the next. Sometimes the energy is euphoric and powerful, inspiring dancing and drumming. Other times it is calm, introspective, nurturing and subtle. Afterwards, it always seems to feel like you got what you needed!

Kirtan is an ancient practice yet it is constantly evolving. DJs and MCs are adding to the musical conversation, like DJ Drez -- https://bit.ly/2qeDbfe

Other modern kirtan artists to check out: Krishna Das -- https://bit.ly/2EuP4CO , Jai Uttal, Wah, Deva Premal & Miten, MC Yogi, DJ Drez, Ben Leinbach.

♦ ♦ ♦ Our kirtan is 100% donation based, and your donations support bringing music classes to children in Bangkok through the Khlong Toey Music Program. ♦ ♦ ♦

name: Crush Your Insecurity - Life Coaching in Bangkok
description:
If there is something you want that you don't yet have (whether it is a change, an income, a house, a business, or a relationship), a coaching conversation will help you realize what is the real reason you don't already have it. Usually, it's not the same reason you've been telling yourself in your head. There're always hidden self-limiting beliefs that you've been protecting, which has stopped you from being, doing, and having what you really want.

A coaching conversation starts with something you want that you don't yet have in your life and ends with your action steps to be on the other side as soon as possible. Meanwhile, helping you clear up your own negative voices in your head that have been stopping you from being who you're meant to be for so many years. No topic is too small or too silly for a coaching conversation because if you want it, you deserve to have it.

The life coaching conversation technique can only be done by those with an extensive training because without a proper training and the right inner work that the coach practices herself day in and day out, a client could come out of the session feeling belittled and undeserving of what they want, having been heavily affected by the coach's own insecurity.

A good coach holds the client "a space to create" where the client is not put down by what's possible and what's not but to be given a place to explore all the steps needed to live out their vision board.
organizer_bio: I help clients discover their self-limiting beliefs and delete them out of their systems in order to show up in life in a bigger way feeling deserving of everything they want, whether it’s a house, a business, or a relationship.

name: Bangkok VueJS and ColdBox MVC (CFML) Developers Group
description:
This group is targeting students, developers, freelancers and corporate power users who are keen to learn about modern CFML (ColdFusion) technology. The ColdFusion platform has come a long way since the 1990's. Deeply anchored in Java, CFML is today a modern open source ColdFusion technology stack. Our company, Connectrust, is based in Singapore and organise training and workshops around CFML and JavaScript throughout South East Asia, under Aquarius Logics, its technology arm. 

Our technology focus is on Coldbox, an open source MVC framework for ColdFusion (CFML), fully supported by Ortus Solutions, a company based in Houston, TX (USA), and a vibrant community of developers in the US and in Europe. We see a great opportunity to develop partnerships by promoting this technology in South East Asia. Coldbox provides a development standard for working in team environments and a modular architecture that leverages open source Lucee and Adobe Coldfusion Java engines. It integrates with modern Javascript front-ends such as Vue.js either via APIs or directly within the ColdBox framework, while the Lucee CFML engine allows relational databases such as MySQL and document databases such as MongoDB to co-exist on the server side.

Look up our Facebook page for the latest news: https://www.facebook.com/aqualogics
organizer_bio: Managing partner at Aquarius Logics in Singapore. We design solutions and provide software development services using Vue.js on the front-end and Coldbox MVC on open source Lucee CFML engine (Java), on the server.

As Libertarians, we seek a world of liberty; a world in which all individuals are sovereign over their own lives and no one is forced to sacrifice his or her values for the benefit of others.

We believe that respect for individual rights is the essential precondition for a free and prosperous world, that force and fraud must be banished from human relationships, and that only through freedom can peace and prosperity be realized.

Consequently, we defend each person's right to engage in any activity that is peaceful and honest, and welcome the diversity that freedom brings. The world we seek to build is one where individuals are free to follow their own dreams in their own ways, without interference from government or any authoritarian power.

We have set forth our basic principles and enumerated various policy stands derived from those principles.

These specific policies are not our goal, however. Our goal is nothing more nor less than a world set free in our lifetime, and it is to this end that we take these stands.

description: Meet fellow book lovers who want to read and discuss great literature.  Since we will meet once a month only, the books that we discuss should be ones that have been around for a while and that we know are good and have a lasting value. Therefore the main criterion for our selection is that books "have stood the test of time", and after a couple of name changes for our group I think that the new name Timeless Classics expresses best what we have in mind. All members are invited to send me suggestions for books to discuss, that I will put on my ever growing list. Every month I take three books from the list and put them up for a vote for the following month.

name: Data Council Bangkok Data Engineering & Science
description:
Data Council Bangkok Data Engineering & Science hosts events where lead engineers & data scientists from pre-screened companies present talks on their projects for the benefit of the data community. Bangkok based companies are doing amazing things with data and we've created this event to help them showcase their work and help other engineers level up.

What you'll gain from this group:

• A better understanding of the best OS tools to use in building your own data infrastructure (pipelines, platforms, storage options, etc.)

• Real-world examples from top technical companies explaining the data platforms their engineers are building

• Applied data science talks that explain the minimum level of algorithmic understanding engineers should have to work better with their data science counterparts, or to become a Machine Learning Engineer-unicorn themselves

• Highly technical conversations with other attendees, and announcements of the best data events and opportunities in the Bangkok area

This group is an independently organized Data Council group and is sponsored by Data Council (https://www.datacouncil.ai).

Other DataCouncil.ai Local Meetups can be found here:

https://www.datacouncil.ai/community

name: The First Thai Toastmasters Club
description:
Toastmasters เป็นสถานที่ที่คุณสามารถฝึกการสื่อสารได้อย่างมั่นใจและปราศจากความกดดัน ที่สโมสรเราคุณจะได้เรียนรู้เทคนิคการพูดและการเป็นผู้นำที่สามารถนำไปใช้ได้ตลอดชีวิต

ยินดีต้อนรับสู่ The First Thai Toastmaster Club

มาร่วมสนุกในการประชุม TM ได้ทุกวันพุธที่ 1,3 และ 5 ของทุกเดือน ตั้งแต่เวลา 1...

9:00-21:00 น. ถ้าอยากมาทานข้าวด้วยกัน สามารถมาได้ตอน 18:30 น. ที่มหาวิทยาลัยคริสเตียน สภาคริสตจักรในประเทศไทย ชั้น 8 ใกล้สถานีรถไฟฟ้า ราชเทวี The First Thai Toastmasters คืออะไร? เรียนรู้วิธีที่จะสื่อสารอย่างมั่นใจและฉะฉาน คุณเคยมั้ย ที่เวลาจะสื่อสารอะไรบางอย่างต่อหน้าผู้คนแล้วรู้สึกกลัว ไม่มั่นใจและไม่รู้ว่าจะพูดอะไร มันเป็นปัญหาที่พบเจอได้บ่อยๆ ทำให้กลายคนไม่สามารถก้าวหน้าในตำแหน่งที่สูงขึ้นไปได้ Toastmasters เป็นสถานที่ที่คุณสามารถฝึกการสื่อสารได้อย่างมั่นใจและปราศจากความกดดัน ที่สโมสรเราคุณจะได้เรียนรู้เทคนิคการพูดและการเป็นผู้นำที่สามารถนำไปใช้ได้ตลอดชีวิต สมาชิกของคลับ The First Thai TM คือใครบ้าง? <br>บุคคลทั่วไปจากหลากหลายอาชีพ ทั้งนักธุรกิจ วิศวกร นักออกแบบ วิทยากร นักพูดมืออาชีพ นักศึกษา ดารานักแสดง และอื่นๆอีกมากมาย เราเจอกันเดือนละ 2-3 ครั้ง เพื่อฝึกการสื่อสารและความเป็นผู้นำ นอกจากคุณจะสามารถทำบทพูดได้แล้ว คุณยังร่วมประชุมโดยเป็นพิธีกร ผู้ประเมินผลหรือบทบาทอื่นๆได้

ประชุมเมื่อไหร่ และที่ไหน? พบกันทุกวันพุธที่ 1,3 และ 5 ของทุกเดือน ตั้งแต่เวลา 18:30-20:45 น. ที่มหาวิทยาลัยคริสเตียน ใกล้สถานีรถไฟฟ้า ราชเทวี ค่าประชุม: 200 บาท (รวมค่าอาหารเย็น) การเดินทาง: รถไฟฟ้าสถานีราชเทวี ทางออกโรงแรมเอเชีย เดินออกจากโรงแรมเลี้ยวขวาไปทางสะพานหัวช้าง เลย ร้าน 7-Eleven ประมาณ 30 เมตร จะพบทางเข้ามหาวิทยาลัยด้านขวามือ สามารถเดินทางโดยรถส่วนบุคคลได้ มีที่จอดรถในอาคาร สามารถประทับบัตรจอดรถได้ ห้องประชุมตึกในสุด ชั้น 8 

หมายเหตุ:

1. เวลาเดินเข้าตึก มักจะมีคนถามว่ามีตั๋วหรือยัง ไม่ต้องใส่ใจนะคะ เขาขายตั๋วสำหรับงานชั้น 6 ไม่เกี่ยวกับเราค่ะ

2. เราเช่าที่ที่สภาคริสตจักร แต่สโมสรของเราไม่เกี่ยวกับศาสนา

3. Toastmasters ไม่ใช่เครื่อข่ายขายตรงค่ะ

คุณสามารถติดต่อเราได้โดย:

ส่งข้อความมาที่ Meetup group นี้

ส่งข้อความที่ www.facebook.com/thefirstthaitoastmastersclub 

อีเมล์มาที่ thefirstthaitoastmasters@gmail.com
organizer_bio: Global local

name: Bangkok Shambhala Meditation Group
description: The Bangkok Shambhala Meditation Group is part of an international community of urban meditation and rural retreat centers founded by Chögyam Trungpa Rinpoche and further developed by his son and lineage holder Sakyong Mipham Rinpoche. We offer basic meditation classes, free meditation instruction, a curriculum of Buddhist studies and Shambhala Training—a progressive series of weekend workshops that help students develop a personal meditation practice in order to engage more fully and compassionately in the world. We also provide opportunities for communal gatherings, celebrations, and events. We invite you to explore our diverse programs designed to help people of all traditions discover their inherent sanity, gentleness and humor.
organizer_bio: I've been a meditation practitioner since 1993, and a student of Sakyong Mipham Rinpoche since 1996. In 2005 I become a Shambhala (certified) meditation instructor. In 2006 I moved to Thailand, and shortly thereafter, started this group in Bangkok!

name: Saksit Meditation & Healing Sessions
description: Explore the depths of your inner self as you meditate and bless the world, a prayer at a time.

name: Learning Thai with Mission
description:
Hi, Everyone

I'm a native Thai speaker, living in Bangkok. This group is for the foreigners who want to learn Thai in the different way besides sit and talk on the table. My class is about to walk around the place and create a daily conversation. And we have some mission for you to push your confidence to speak Thai.

As we move around the place, so I prefer a small group of 3-5 persons/time. And everyone will get improve your Thai skill. the location may change each time depends on what topic I pick up, but I'll try my best to set up in BTS/MRT areas.

My purpose for creating this group is to find the opportunity to speak English. And I usually bring my son with me so he can get practicing his English too.

All of our meetings are FREE OF CHARGE, You can learn Thai for FREE. We don't have any commercial purpose. BUT in some mission we create may have a few costs, which you can decide to pay or not, likes buying stuff, shopping in supermarket, transportation, try street foods,etc.

My English is not an advanced level but we still can communicate in English. And my sister can speak in Chinese and Japanese also. So if you can communicate in Thai, English, Chinese or Japanese, we are always welcome you to join us.

If you have any questions or want to request the topic, you can send me a direct message. Or If you want to make up a private class on your own available time, feel free to contact me also. Hope to see you guys soon!

Thank you.

Joy

ปล. เนื่องจากว่ากลุ่มของเรา เป็นการสอนภาษาไทยให้ชาวต่างชาติเป็นหลัก และไม่มีจุดประสงค์ในการแลกเปลี่ยนภาษา จึงขออนุญาตไม่รับคนไทยในกิจกรรมนะคะ ขอบคุณค่ะ
organizer_bio: Hi, I'm a full-time freelancer living in Bangkok. I'm looking for making new friends to exchange language and experience. If you're looking for a Thai partner to help you around Bangkok. Feel free to contact me. Hope to see you guys, Thanks.

name: Acting Training Bangkok
description: At MasterClass Studio we offer acting courses, workshops, and training in different acting techniques. For kids as well as for grown-ups. If you are interested in becoming an actors, want to gain more self-confidence, or become a better public speaker, this is the place to go!

name: Rock Stars
description:
This group is for anyone interested in Crystal Healing, Self-development and learning how to work with crystals and stones. Rock Stars isn't your typical crystal healing group.  It's for people that want to experience the best of themselves and are willing to do the work to get there.  The crystals themselves teach, guide and show us our flaws(and our beauty) with non-judgement.  It is our responsibility to heal.  I hope you are ready because it's a wonderful journey.  


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BDfpB7lz6Fc
organizer_bio: I work as a Professional Energy Healer, Crystal Reiki Master Teacher and Reiki Master Teacher.

name: Insight Mindfulness Community Bangkok
description:
For both English & Thai speaking professionals, entrepreneurs, or freelancers who wants to join community of practice for Mindfulness, resulting in better focus, productivity, wellness, and resilience.

This group is led by Kang Som, Founder and corporate trainer at Insight Mindfulness Leadership Institute, and teacher in training for, Search Inside Yourself Program, based on mindfulness, emotional intelligence & neuroscience, develop at Google.
organizer_bio: I'm passionate about transforming the World Leaders to be more compassionate & understanding, one mindful breathe at a time. I'm corporate trainer & mindfulness coach. I'm active, environmental conscious, open-minded and life long learners.

name: Bangkok Padel Gang
description:
If you like racket sports like tennis, badminton, table tennis, squash, you will probably like padel as well.

Padel is a fairly new sport but it is already very popular in countries like Spain, Argentina and Sweden. Most professional players are from Spain and Argentina and they play on the World Padel Tour (WPT). But Padel is expanding worldwide and many countries play it already with their own leagues and events.

This meetup will bring players together and hold events regarding padel.

name: Bangkok Exclusive Meetup
description:
- Bangkok Exclusive Meetup is a casual meetup of Bangkokians. Come hangout and meet other Bangkokians professionals in your city.

- We development and maintenance of its members's health and social life 

- Meet new people

name: Paul's Reiki Meetup Group
description: I am a Reiki Level Two practitioner with many decades of other energy channeling and similar experience. As part of my Reiki training I am offering free Reiki sessions to people interested in learning more about Reiki and experiencing a session. By sharing Reiki with you I am preparing for my next level of training - Reiki Master.

name: ICB Evening Worship
description: Anyone interested in seeking God, deepening faith, worshiping freely is invited to join us. We meet up weekly to sing, pray, study the Bible, and care for one another. We are an international group from over 30 nations united in our desire to worship in English and worship God revealed to us in Jesus. Whether new to the faith, a committed Christian, or just looking for English-speaking fellowship, come check us out!

name: Painting/Drawing Classes (Daytime)
description:
A lovely art studio in the heart of Bangkok (45/4 Sukhimvit Soi 31) that offers various oil and acrylic painting workshops and events!

If you are an experienced painter looking to brush up on skills and technique, a tourist looking for something new and different to try on holiday, or just a beginner looking to get the basics and techniques of composition, color, and line - then our events are for you!

<br>

<br>
organizer_bio:
"Add a little colour to your world with us!"

Our art studio has a long, colorful history, right in the bustling heart of Bangkok. 
We offer various art lessons run by experienced art instructors, and there are classes for all ages at a good price!

name: Canada Friendship Society
description:
Canada Friendship Society (CFS) is the largest Canadian social organization in Thailand with over 300 members and growing. We strive to be a home away from home for Canadians and amicable others in Bangkok functioning in accordance with many of Canada’s best values including equality, inclusivity, irreverence, and cordiality.

We charge no membership fee and welcome all backgrounds: men and women, Canadians and foreigners, retirees, businesspersons, and travellers. Regular social events include to brunches, dinners and cocktails, physical activities such as morning walks, marathons and yoga, attending local events and much more. Our members have very different backgrounds and interests, but the common thread is interest in Canada and great conversations.

Our events are a great way to meet new people, develop strong friendships, help each other, experience a bit of Canada while around the world, stay connected in and just enjoy yourself. 

Connect meetup and FB and we hope we’ll get to know you!


We host some events at members residences and respect the wishes of our membership desiring anonymity. As such we take privacy seriously and do not reveal our members or personal details.

 All new members must be fluent in English or French. We cannot help with immigration or dating/matchmaking. Identifiable profile photo and name are required.

name: Self Empowerment Bangkok
description:
This group's purpose is to build a support community for those individuals interested in Self Discovery, Personal Development and Self Actualization.

<br>This group will be of great interest to those Career Professionals that would like to learn about the Psychology of Success and how to inject more meaning and purpose in the personal and professional lives. <br>This is a great opportunity for individuals to connect with other like minded people and a great opportunity to make some great new friends.

<br>We do look forward to meeting you soon and feel free to contact us.

Luke and Susana Hancock. <br>
organizer_bio:
Luke Hancock is the co-founder of Sacred Place, delivering courses in Self Empowerment in Asia. www.sacred-place.com/courses.

Luke is the author of the life changing book The Inner Revolution. Download free here: www.sacred-place.com/the-book

name: Bkk Book Club
description: สำหรับคนที่อยากปรับปรุงภาษาอังกฤษแต่ขี้เกียจอ่านหนังสือ เรามาอ่านด้วยกันได้ Mainly for Thais who want to improve their English writing (and comprehension) through strategic reading in a group setting. Native speakers who want to help are also welcome.
organizer_bio: Global local

name: Bangkok Line Dance Meetup
description:
This group is open to anyone who likes to try line dancing (or already knows and wants to keep practicing). Total beginners are welcome, as it is especially meant to be a fun activity while learning line dancing steps to folk and country music. The meetups will be organised by Bep Fleuren-Lucassen, who caught the line dance bug in Austria a few years ago and Bonnie Zellerbach.

The meet up will be 2x a week: on Thursday and Saturday mornings from 10:00 - 11:30 at Urban Dance Studio near Asoke. Please sign up in advance on this website for the meetups, the number of Line Dancers attending will decide whether we use the big or small Dance room at the Dance Studio.

name: Achieve Your Goals
description:
Missed your goals in 2018? Do you have ambitious goals for 2019? Feel directionless? Stuck in life? Unable to truly achieve your potential? 

Come to join us at this event to learn how Dr.Andrew lives a purposeful life AND gets things done! 

By attending you will get a clear, measurable life planning and execution system -- the system Andrew uses. Use this event to build a support network of like-minded people.

name: Ansible Bangkok
description: We are a group of Systems Engineers and DevOps folks who want to Ansible all the things. Want to learn more about Ansible? Come join us. Already know Ansible well? Come share your knowledge.

name: Spanish Bangkok
description:
Hello!

I love to teach our culture and customs.

Join us! Enjoy our Spanish cultural meetings and foods!

Spanish fun games, tapas, free flow of sangria and every Saturday you will learn some Spanish while you enjoy a great afternoon!

name: Pint of Science Thailand
description: The Pint of Science Thailand (www.pintofscienceth.com) is part of an international group (Pint of Science) for anyone interested in science, science communication, as well as the ethics and social aspects of science. Please join if you want to hear about the newest research or discoveries in science or simply enjoy the magic of physics, chemistry, biology etc. We also welcome you if are a scientist, a science communicator or science teacher yourself and want to share your work in a relaxed environment. This group aims to bring bite-size (or rather pintb-size) science into cafes and pubs in a fun and entertaining way, thereby making science more widely accessible. It is also an opportunity for scientists, health researchers, science teachers and science communicators in Thailand and the region to get to know each other. The organisers of Pint of Science Thailand are part of the Mahidol Oxford Tropical Medicine Research Unit, collaboration between University of Oxford and Mahidol University.

name: Travel Lovers Bangkok - Travelers, bloggers, digital nomads
description:
A groupe for passionate travelers who loves to share travel and life experiences around this beautiful world! <br>Come to share a drink and a travel experience!!

******************************
MeetUp organisation is kindly sponsored by Shego - Sharing experiences on the go!

Share your travel experiences on the website https://travelshego.live and follow us on instagram and facebook (@travelshego).
Share, travel, inspire!
organizer_bio:
Traveller, engineer, proud founder of Shego - Sharing experiences on the go! @travelshego.live
Feel free to ask for travel advices, I'm always happy to share my experiences on the road!

name: Anoop Shala: Kundalini Yoga in Bangkok
description: Interested in improving your physical and mental health, focusing on your spiritual development and connecting like-minded people? Kundalini Yoga might be exactly what you are looking for. Known as the yoga of awareness, Kundalini is an ancient and comprehensive form of Yoga combining mantra (sound), pranayama (breath), asana (posture), relaxation and meditation. Complete beginners are very welcome to come along and experience the magic.

name: Bangkok Geeks
description:
This meetup is for artists and fans of all things ART (Movies, Comic books, Anime, series, stand up comedy etc.)
This group will consist of :
-Discussions about the creations we love,
-Drawing workshops for those who want to learn to draw.

If you love movies, comic books, games, etc. But can't find anyone to have exciting discussions about them, COME AND JOIN US.

Little bit about me: I'm a Cartoonist, Podcaster, Youtuber who loves movies and comic books. I speak Tamil, English and French and a little bit Spanish.

name: Bangkok Meetup for Meditation
description:
People that are stressed out by life and want to find a quiet place inside themselves. People that want to improve themselves. People that want to learn what meditation is. People that want to learn different meditation techniques.

Personally, I meditate on a daily basis. I want to start a group with people that want to join my meditation practice. At first the meditation workshop will be on a weekly basis, but I hope it can turn into a daily meditation session.

name: Bangkok Typography
description: This group is for anyone who in love with typography. Especially, Thai typography, (ตัวอักษรไทย) we are proud to have our own speaking language and alphabets since many years ago. Thai tradition attributes the creation of the script to King Ramkhamhaeng the Great (Thai: พ่อขุนรามคำแหงมหาราช) in 1283. We like to do some discussion group and workshop to develop and even collect any data. I hope that this will benefit Thai later generation in some ways. All skill levels are welcome. I will start this group to meet up as soon as we have enough people. I didn't not expect many people or a big group, but I expect people who have sole and passion in typography. Looking forward to exploring this area with everybody soon.

name: Hula Hoop Dancing Class
description: “Let's get together for Hula Hoop Dancing Class. The class is suitable for any ages any genders. We will learn how to dance with hula-hoop and have some fun with it. Let's go out and exercise together with the music.  I will accept the donation for the class. Any amount of lesson fee will help my mom for breasts cancer treatment. Love and Light!

name: Bangkok Food & Travel Buddies
description:
We have lots of good food in Bangkok, especially Asian ones: Thai, Japanese, Vietnamese, Korean, Indian.... we also have many cool places and cultures in Asia to discover...

Usually we will have one or two persons from that country's food to share about that food story, that country culture or travel...

Come join us!

--------------------

<br>

name: BangkokScots - The Bangkok St Andrews Society
description:
The Bangkok St. Andrew's Society was established in 1890 by a small group of expatriate Scots stationed in what was then Siam and is the oldest of the 4 "Loyal" Societies (St. Patrick's, St. David's and St. George's) in Thailand. Over the years it has gone through many developments but remains true to its original roots as a Society for Scots, those of Scots descent and those with an interest in all things Scottish to meet and celebrate the Scottish culture.

The Society's year revolves around three major social events:- The Burns Supper in late January, the Mid-Year Kiddies Highland games in September, culminating in the St. Andrew's Ball in late November or early December on a weekend near St. Andrew's Day.

You don't have to be Scottish to join - you just need to enjoy Scottish culture.

name: Scoop on 15 Wine Tasting
description:
As we all know, because of the tax situation in the Kingdom wine is incredibly overpriced and it's important to find the right wines at the best price.

We'll be tasting good wine. Mostly reasonably priced with the occasionalvery expensive wine. A themed monthly meeting at the Scoop on 15 Bar, between Sukhumvit Soi 13 and 15.

An opportunity to meet other wine lovers, taste, score, discuss (and if you wish - buy) your favourites.

Open to all from novice to Master of Wine (we would love your input and recommendations).

Drink what you enjoy and can afford. No snobishness here - a convivial atmosphere provided by our host Sunan (K Oh - novice) and her friends or just pop into the bar for a drink.

Please join us for a happy night from 7:00 PM (Bar opens 5:00 PM until late)

We look forward to seeing you!
organizer_bio: Entrepreneur, bar owner and manager

name: Drucker Society Thai Meetup
description: Sharing the Drucker Practice. How to apply the drucker guideline into the workplace. Discuss about how to apply the durcker content into real-case.

name: Aussie expats in Bangkok meet and network
description: A group for Australians in Bangkok who would like to get to know other Aussies in Bangkok. A place where people can gain knowledge about living in Thailand from other Australians who have been here longer. A great way to spend an arvo watching the AFL or a midweek State of Origin. Planning on holding meetups for drinks and casual networking gatherings. Looking at various meeting places upon members requests Open to all

name: Bangkok's Heal Your Life (inspired by Louise L. Hay) Meetup
description:
Join Nudang, Licensed Heal Your Life Workshop Leader, for heart-centered sharing and discussions. Develop awareness and appreciation for life with like-minded people who are on their self-discovery journeys. Be supported and uplifted by the group along your path towards real-I-zation and understanding.

Bring your open heart and willingness to change for the better, pen/pencil, and journal.

name: Fitness Bangkok
description:
We are committed to offering fun, effective and educational fitness programs and activities to promote health and fitness in Bangkok! Fitness Bangkok Group is for all Bangkok residents who are looking to meet up, make friends who share the same values and interests, specifically, health and fitness!

Whether you are a health club member, bootcamper, fitness enthusiast, fitness professional, weekend fitness warrior, social sport player or active healthy individual, FB is here to help you get connected with others who share the same passion for fitness and health!

FB is designed to give options for a socially 'fit' network of friends. We develop weekend fitness trips, monthly fitness seminars, meet ups and activities for all of us to be inspired, get in great shape and motivate us to stay on track, be fit and be healthy.

We also happen to be a team of professional fitness and personal trainers who have the years of experience to take your fitness and sports performance to the next level. So if you want to just meet like minded fitness enthusiasts, train for an event, share ideas, learn, nutrition, tennis or workout, lose weight or find buddies to play golf, FB is a great platform to do just that! Be INSPIRED! And invite your friends!
organizer_bio: CEO, Founder of http://www.theaspireclub.com - Personal trainer Bangkok, CrossFit Bangkok,  outdoor fitness Bootcamp Bangkok, golf fitness, sports performance, fat loss challenges, nutrition coaching, fitness weekends, Physiotherapy.

name: Underground Electronic Music Hunters
description:
This is a group so those people who are into quality underground electronic music can post and go to some gigs together. There are a lot of people in BKK here who are into this music and this is a way of connecting people in the dance community, as well as ensuring that if you have a gig you want to go to you can assemble a posse of friendly open minded people (I know for me personally I miss having a posse of people to attend gigs with; some of my friends go but mostly they are turning into grandmas and grandpas!) So I will make it so anyone can post a gig they want to go to on this page and then people can join them! If anyone has any other ideas or suggestions please contact me- this group will be run democratically and input would be great :)

name: BKK Deep Dive: More productive co-working for digital nomads
description:
The 6 most productive hours... of... your... life... And all before 4pm.

About you:
You need to finish that thesis, that sprint, that book, that proposal, or whatever's else is on your scary to-do list. You have work to do, and no time to mess around.
But you also wanna get your work done sooner to enjoy some sunshine, your hobby, that side hustle, get fit, go to the pub, or to be a better parent.
You understand that if you can really get on top of your productivity, you'll feel better about yourself, and you'll have time for the things and people you love.

What Is Deep Diving?:
A unique approach to co-working productivity based around a deep sea diving analogy: The Deep Divers form a Dive Team. They buddy up and help each other prioritise work, set and track targets, be accountable to them, and fiercely defend each other from sharks (distractions).

What happens on a Dive Day?
There are 3 x 2hr Dive Sessions, where we descend into The Deep, an area of zero distractions... nothing to do but work. Each Dive Session has 4 Dives of 25 mins where we plunge deeply into our work. Between each Dive we will take 5 minutes to decompress in the Dive Bell, an area of minimal distractions where buddies quickly check in. Between each 2hr Dive Session, the Dive Team returns to the surface to have a coffee, a meal, and to talk tactics on improving productivity.

15 min coffee break
2hr Midday Dive Session
30 min lunch
2hr afternoon Dive Session
Leave!**

Everything you need to get your work done independently

A brain running on a good night's rest and a healthy breakfast
